node.title: Masked No More?
node.alt: New Jersey will drop its mask mandate for students and school employees in the second week of March.
node.description: Noses — and maybe smiles — may soon make an appearance in some classrooms, now that several states plan to end mask mandates.
node.content: ["Today, we\u2019re covering states relaxing mask mandates in schools and the likely end of President Biden\u2019s plan for free community college. Plus, a podcast recommendation.", "Children may soon go maskless in classrooms, as several governors have announced that they will end or not renew statewide mandates.", "On Wednesday, Gov. Charlie Baker announced that Massachusetts will drop its statewide school mask mandate when it expires on Feb. 28, leaving the decision to local districts.", "As elsewhere, the governor\u2019s decision does not mean all students will be able to unmask on March 1. Rather, it allows local districts to follow their own policies, many of which have been painstakingly negotiated among school boards, district officials and teachers\u2019 unions.", "The announcement by Baker, a Republican, follows other states that have also loosened restrictions.", "All focus is now on Illinois, New York and California. Those Democratic-led states still have school mask mandates in place.", "Gov. J.B. Pritzker of Illinois will probably unveil a plan for school masking on Wednesday afternoon.", "\u201cWe\u2019re very close,\u201d he said on Tuesday.", "Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York will drop the state\u2019s stringent indoor mask mandate on Wednesday, but has said she needs more time to decide about masking in schools.", "Last week, Hochul said that officials were \u201cstriving\u201d to remove mask mandates in schools, but that vaccination rates for younger children needed to rise.", "\u201cWe\u2019ll be making some announcements in the short term as we see these numbers progressing,\u201d she said last week.", "In California, officials announced Monday that the state will end a universal indoor mask mandate next week, and are reviewing the mask mandate for schools.", "The announcements, a loosely coordinated effort, are the result of months of public-health planning, back-channel discussions and political focus groups that began in the weeks after the November election.", "Cases are now falling in these and other states, after the Omicron variant fueled explosive waves of new infections. School districts can continue to require mask wearing or restore the rules if the virus spikes again.", "\u201cThis is not a declaration of victory as much as an acknowledgment that we can responsibly live with this thing,\u201d Gov. Philip Murphy of New Jersey said Monday. Murphy, who had imposed some of the nation\u2019s toughest pandemic-related mandates, described it as a \u201chuge step toward normalcy.\u201d", "Many prominent doctors have begun to question the value of requiring students to wear masks as new virus cases decline across the country. They cite the mental health strain that children have faced during the pandemic, and the educational value of seeing full faces.", "[For more, check out Tuesday\u2019s issue of The Morning newsletter, where David Leonhardt analyzed the shift away from masks in schools.]", "Jill Biden, the first lady, acknowledged on Monday that the Biden administration\u2019s promise to provide two years of free community college to all eligible students is \u201cno longer\u201d part of the Democrats\u2019 spending bill, which they are trying to whittle down in order to salvage.", "The bill would have originally committed $45.5 billion to waive two years of tuition at community colleges for five years, a measure that has been cut from the framework. ", "\u201cCongress hasn\u2019t passed the Build Back Better legislation \u2014 yet,\u201d Dr. Biden, a community college English professor, said to a summit of community college leaders on Monday. \u201cAnd free community college is no longer a part of that package.\u201d", "Critics of the community college plan had pointed to high dropout rates and poor outcomes at some of the schools; fewer than 40 percent of community college students earn a degree within six years.", "But research has shown that waiving tuition at community colleges could lift not just enrollment among students who might not otherwise attend college, but also their wages for years to come.", "Eliminating tuition also makes the decision to enroll much easier, economists and researchers said.", "\u201cThese aren\u2019t just bills or budgets to me, to you, right?\u201d Dr. Biden told the educators on Monday. \u201cWe know what they mean for real people, for our students.\u201d", "College", "Race and identity", "And the rest \u2026", "I\u2019m absolutely engrossed in the newest podcast from Serial Productions and The Times, \u201cThe Trojan Horse Affair.\u201d", "The show starts with a letter that described an elaborate plot by Islamic extremists to infiltrate schools in Birmingham, England, and blooms into a frustrating and disturbing portrait about people leveraging racial fears to change education policy.", "\u201cThe letter was later revealed to be a hoax,\u201d my colleague Aina Khan writes about the project. \u201cBut at the time, it provoked national outcry and a political crisis over a city unfairly maligned as an incubator for Islamic extremism.\u201d", "As I listen, it seems as if the basic questions \u2014 What\u2019s good for our kids? How did all of this fervor start? Who stands to benefit from a politicized frenzy? \u2014 too often fade from view.", "That\u2019s a podcast recommendation. For some easy watching, check out \u201cAbbott Elementary,\u201d a new mockumentary sitcom by Quinta Brunson about a Philadelphia public school, which our critic described as a relatable show for teachers during a period of intense stress.", "That\u2019s it for this week\u2019s briefing. If you have questions for our education reporters, please write to us using this form. We will regularly answer questions in the newsletter.", "Sign up here to get the briefing by email."]
